settings.title: Save 98€: Amplifier + speaker combo
settings.content: Save €98 on our SA1 Amplifier and FORUS Speaker combo. Upgrade your tunes with our sound duo: the FORUS speakers and the SA1 amplifier. Stream music wirelessly, enjoy powerful sound, and admire their sleek design — all at a great price! The discount is automatically applied when you add both the SA1 and FORUS to your cart.

settings.title: Passive Speakers?
settings.content: Think of them as the OGs of sound. They play it cool, but need an external amp to bring the noise. Here's the cool part, though: all the high-tech stuff lives in the amp. So, your speakers can hang with you for ages. Just swap out the amp when you're craving a tech refresh. This setup's all about making it your own – mix, match, and upgrade whenever you feel like it. And setting them up? Easy-peasy. Just connect them to your amp with some speaker wire, and you're ready to rock!

settings.title: Why settle for less? Experience pure hi-fi!
settings.content:
Tempted by a 'smart speaker'? Think again before you buy. When it comes to rich musical experiences, hi-fi is the way to go. And guess what?

The SA1 amp and FORUS speakers are a match made in audio heaven. While these might look delicate, the sound they produce rivals even the biggest names out there. And the color? Tailored to your taste.

Our bundle offers some of the most essential smart wireless techs. Why deprive yourself of authentic sound when there are stylish options just waiting for you?

settings.subheading: What Argon Audio speaker should you choose?
settings.title: FORUS 4, 5 & 55
settings.content:
Choosing your speaker system's size isn't just about the outer dimensions; it's also about the power packed inside. The numbers 4/5/55 refer to the size of the bass/midrange unit in the speaker, and the numbering system is quite clever. The FORUS 4 is sleek and compact, perfect for those tight on space, while the FORUS 55 dominates as the towering giant, equipped with dual 5-inch units for those who dare to go big.

The FORUS 4 stands out as the most compact option, perfect for a low-key setup by your TV, especially for surround sound environments. Moving up, the FORUS 5 brings a richer bass and louder sound, making it a great fit for moderately sized spaces.

At the top of the line, the FORUS 55 is the go-to for the large living room, especially if you're after strong bass and a sound that fills the space during your movie marathons, or if you're just chasing the ultimate audio experience. Ultimately, the decision hinges on the speaker's intended location, your room's size, and how much you value design and aesthetics.

settings.subheading: What Argon Audio speaker should you choose?
settings.title: FORUS 4 WALL VS. 5 WALL
settings.content:
Our on-wall series comes in both 4" and 5" variants, designed to blend seamlessly into your space. The FORUS 4 WALL, perfect for those who prefer a minimalist approach, fits snugly next to your TV, in the living room, or as the unsung hero in a surround sound setup. While it may not shake the room with the deepest bass, it stands out as a sleek, nearly invisible solution that transforms into a powerhouse stereo system – especially with the addition of a subwoofer.

The larger FORUS 5 WALL, on the other hand, is slightly bigger and provides more depth. This is true both in terms of physical dimensions (13 cm vs. 10 cm depth for the FORUS 4 WALL) and sound. With extra cabinet space, it pumps out a fuller, more deep bass, resulting in a richer sound experience.
Both models are discreet options that can be mounted directly on the wall, either horizontally or vertically.

settings.title: What's so great about stereo sound?
settings.content:
What's so great about stereo sound? While your soundbar might be great, and your streaming speaker in the kitchen is very convenient, they can only produce 'mono' sound, which can often sound flat. It will never be able to compete with the sound experience you get with a stereo setup.

Stereo sound allows for a fully immersive experience, where you can locate the origin of sounds, discern different tonalities, and even feel the vibrations on your skin. This is not just a marketing claim, as studies have shown that humans are naturally designed to perceive sound in stereo.

Just imagine how you would feel if a movie theater only had a soundbar or if a concert had speakers on just one side. What if you could only wear a headphone on one ear while gaming? You wouldn't be happy, so why settle for less at home when you can have the same great stereo sound experience?
